# Fortran compiler as a dependencie of openmpi package ?

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/770100765f0ebd6943780c6cddb1dfea970dcdd6/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openmpi/package.py#L283

##  Issue
I got an error : 
```
==> Installing openmpi
==> Fetching http://www.open-mpi.org/software/ompi/v3.0/downloads/openmpi-3.0.0.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /root/Spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-4k4itv72zq7vbpmjuhzlcedbcpc6cyju/openmpi-3.0.0.tar.bz2
==> Created stage in /root/Spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-4k4itv72zq7vbpmjuhzlcedbcpc6cyju
==> No patches needed for openmpi
==> Building openmpi [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Error: InstallError: OpenMPI requires both C and Fortran compilers!
InstallError: InstallError: OpenMPI requires both C and Fortran compilers!

/root/Spack/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openmpi/package.py:289, in die_without_fortran:
     4             # avoid delayed build errors in dependents.
     5             if (self.compiler.f77 is None) or (self.compiler.fc is None):
     6                 raise InstallError(
  >> 7                     'OpenMPI requires both C and Fortran compilers!'
     8                 )

See build log for details:
  /root/Spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-4k4itv72zq7vbpmjuhzlcedbcpc6cyju/openmpi-3.0.0/spack-build.out


more /root/Spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-4k4itv72zq7vbpmjuhzlcedbcpc6cyju/openmpi-3.0.0/spack-build.out
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'

```


## Explanation

After installing Spack on a fresh Ubuntu 16.04 (inside a Docker) I ran :  
```bash
spack install --only=dependencies mycustomlib_that_depend_of_scotch
```
To install dependencies to my library.
I suspect that Fortran compiler is not listed as a dependencie of openmpi package.
So Fortran compiler is not installed by Spack.
But I don't know how works Spack package dependencies for compilers.

## Reproduction 
If you want to reproduce, these lines - *a bit different than mines* - should be enough.

```bash
docker pull ubuntu:16.04
docker run -it ubuntu:16.04

cd ~/
which git || ( apt-get update -y && apt-get install git -y )
which curl || ( apt-get update -y && apt-get install curl -y )
which module || ( apt-get update -y && apt-get install environment-modules -y )
which python || ( apt-get update -y && apt-get install python -y )
mkdir -p Spack && cd Spack
git clone https://github.com/llnl/spack.git
module() { eval `/usr/bin/modulecmd bash $*`; }
source spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh  

spack install --only=dependencies scotch
```

Regards,
Benjamin
